title: Anthem
words: ANTHEM       by Ayn Rand         CONTENTS          PART ONE          PART TWO          PART THREE          PART FOUR          PART FIVE          PART SIX          PART SEVEN          PART EIGHT          PART NINE          PART TEN          PART ELEVEN          PART TWELVE       PART ONE       It is a sin to write this

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is a sin to think words no others       think and to put them down upon a paper no others are to see

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It       is base and evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is as if we were speaking alone to no ears       but our own

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we know well that there is no transgression       blacker than to do or think alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have broken the laws

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The       laws say that men may not write unless the Council of Vocations       bid them so

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: May we be forgiven

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But this is not the only sin upon us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have committed a greater       crime and for this crime there is no name

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What punishment       awaits us if it be discovered we know not for no such crime has       come in the memory of men and there are no laws to provide for       it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is dark here

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The flame of the candle stands still in the air

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Nothing moves in this tunnel save our hand on the paper

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are       alone here under the earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is a fearful word alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The laws       say that none among men may be alone ever and at any time for       this is the great transgression and the root of all evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we       have broken many laws

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And now there is nothing here save our one       body and it is strange to see only two legs stretched on the       ground and on the wall before us the shadow of our one head

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The walls are cracked and water runs upon them in thin threads       without sound black and glistening as blood

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stole the candle       from the larder of the Home of the Street Sweepers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall be       sentenced to ten years in the Palace of Corrective Detention if       it be discovered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But this matters not

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It matters only that the       light is precious and we should not waste it to write when we       need it for that work which is our crime

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Nothing matters save       the work our secret our evil our precious work

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Still we must       also write formay the Council have mercy upon uswe wish to       speak for once to no ears but our own

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our name is Equality 72521 as it is written on the iron       bracelet which all men wear on their left wrists with their names       upon it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are twentyone years old

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are six feet tall and       this is a burden for there are not many men who are six feet       tall

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Ever have the Teachers and the Leaders pointed to us and       frowned and said       There is evil in your bones Equality 72521 for your body has       grown beyond the bodies of your brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we cannot change       our bones nor our body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We were born with a curse

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It has always driven us to thoughts       which are forbidden

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It has always given us wishes which men may       not wish

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know that we are evil but there is no will in us       and no power to resist it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is our wonder and our secret       fear that we know and do not resist

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We strive to be like all our brother men for all men must be       alike

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Over the portals of the Palace of the World Council there       are words cut in the marble which we repeat to ourselves       whenever we are tempted   WE ARE ONE IN ALL AND ALL IN ONE

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: THERE ARE NO MEN BUT ONLY THE GREAT  WE    ONE INDIVISIBLE AND FOREVER

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We repeat this to ourselves but it helps us not

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These words were cut long ago

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is green mould in the       grooves of the letters and yellow streaks on the marble which       come from more years than men could count

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And these words are       the truth for they are written on the Palace of the World       Council and the World Council is the body of all truth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus has       it been ever since the Great Rebirth and farther back than that       no memory can reach

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we must never speak of the times before the Great Rebirth       else we are sentenced to three years in the Palace of Corrective       Detention

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is only the Old Ones who whisper about it in the       evenings in the Home of the Useless

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They whisper many strange       things of the towers which rose to the sky in those       Unmentionable Times and of the wagons which moved without       horses and of the lights which burned without flame

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But those       times were evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And those times passed away when men saw the       Great Truth which is this that all men are one and that there is       no will save the will of all men together

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: All men are good and wise

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is only we Equality 72521 we       alone who were born with a curse

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For we are not like our       brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And as we look back upon our life we see that it has       ever been thus and that it has brought us step by step to our       last supreme transgression our crime of crimes hidden here       under the ground

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We remember the Home of the Infants where we lived till we were       five years old together with all the children of the City who       had been born in the same year

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sleeping halls there were       white and clean and bare of all things save one hundred beds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       were just like all our brothers then save for the one       transgression we fought with our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There are few       offenses blacker than to fight with our brothers at any age and       for any cause whatsoever

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Council of the Home told us so and       of all the children of that year we were locked in the cellar       most often

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When we were five years old we were sent to the Home of the       Students where there are ten wards for our ten years of       learning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Men must learn till they reach their fifteenth year

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they go to work

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: In the Home of the Students we arose when       the big bell rang in the tower and we went to our beds when it       rang again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Before we removed our garments we stood in the great       sleeping hall and we raised our right arms and we said all       together with the three Teachers at the head       We are nothing

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Mankind is all

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: By the grace of our brothers are       we allowed our lives

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We exist through by and for our brothers       who are the State

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Amen

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we slept

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sleeping halls were white and clean and bare       of all things save one hundred beds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We Equality 72521 were not happy in those years in the Home of       the Students

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was not that the learning was too hard for us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was that the learning was too easy

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is a great sin to be       born with a head which is too quick

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is not good to be       different from our brothers but it is evil to be superior to       them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Teachers told us so and they frowned when they looked       upon us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we fought against this curse

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We tried to forget our lessons       but we always remembered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We tried not to understand what the       Teachers taught but we always understood it before the Teachers       had spoken

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We looked upon Union 53992 who were a pale boy with       only half a brain and we tried to say and do as they did that       we might be like them like Union 53992 but somehow the       Teachers knew that we were not

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we were lashed more often       than all the other children

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Teachers were just for they had been appointed by the       Councils and the Councils are the voice of all justice for they       are the voice of all men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And if sometimes in the secret       darkness of our heart we regret that which befell us on our       fifteenth birthday we know that it was through our own guilt

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       had broken a law for we had not paid heed to the words of our       Teachers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Teachers had said to us all       Dare not choose in your minds the work you would like to do when       you leave the Home of the Students

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: You shall do that which the       Council of Vocations shall prescribe for you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For the Council of       Vocations knows in its great wisdom where you are needed by your       brother men better than you can know it in your unworthy little       minds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And if you are not needed by your brother man there is no       reason for you to burden the earth with your bodies

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We knew this well in the years of our childhood but our curse       broke our will

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We were guilty and we confess it here we were       guilty of the great Transgression of Preference

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We preferred       some work and some lessons to the others

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We did not listen well       to the history of all the Councils elected since the Great       Rebirth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we loved the Science of Things

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wished to know

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wished to know about all the things which make the earth       around us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We asked so many questions that the Teachers forbade       it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We think that there are mysteries in the sky and under the water       and in the plants which grow

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the Council of Scholars has       said that there are no mysteries and the Council of Scholars       knows all things

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we learned much from our Teachers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       learned that the earth is flat and that the sun revolves around       it which causes the day and the night

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We learned the names of       all the winds which blow over the seas and push the sails of our       great ships

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We learned how to bleed men to cure them of all       ailments

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We loved the Science of Things

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And in the darkness in the       secret hour when we awoke in the night and there were no       brothers around us but only their shapes in the beds and their       snores we closed our eyes and we held our lips shut and we       stopped our breath that no shudder might let our brothers see or       hear or guess and we thought that we wished to be sent to the       Home of the Scholars when our time would come

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: All the great modern inventions come f

words: from the Home of the       Scholars such as the newest one which was found only a hundred       years ago of how to make candles from wax and string also how       to make glass which is put in our windows to protect us from the       rain

author: Rand, Ayn

words: To find these things the Scholars must study the earth and       learn from the rivers from the sands from the winds and the       rocks

author: Rand, Ayn

author: Rand, Ayn

words: We could ask questions of these for they do not       forbid questions

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It       whispers to us that there are great things on this earth of ours       and that we can know them if we try and that we must know them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We ask why must we know but it has no answer to give us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       must know that we may know

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we wished to be sent to the Home of the Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wished it       so much that our hands trembled under the blankets in the night       and we bit our arm to stop that other pain which we could not       endure

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was evil and we dared not face our brothers in the       morning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For men may wish nothing for themselves

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we were       punished when the Council of Vocations came to give us our life       Mandates which tell those who reach their fifteenth year what       their work is to be for the rest of their days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Council of Vocations came on the first day of spring and       they sat in the great hall

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we who were fifteen and all the       Teachers came into the great hall

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And the Council of Vocations       sat on a high dais and they had but two words to speak to each       of the Students

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They called the Students names and when the       Students stepped before them one after another the Council       said Carpenter or Doctor or Cook or Leader

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then each       Student raised their right arm and said The will of our       brothers be done

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Now if the Council has said Carpenter or Cook the Students       so assigned go to work and they do not study any further

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But if       the Council has said Leader then those Students go into the       Home of the Leaders which is the greatest house in the City for       it has three stories

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And there they study for many years so       that they may become candidates and be elected to the City       Council and the State Council and the World Councilby a free and       general vote of all men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we wished not to be a Leader even       though it is a great honor

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wished to be a Scholar

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we awaited our turn in the great hall and then we heard the       Council of Vocations call our name Equality 72521

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We walked       to the dais and our legs did not tremble and we looked up at       the Council

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There were five members of the Council three of the       male gender and two of the female

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their hair was white and their       faces were cracked as the clay of a dry river bed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They were old

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They seemed older than the marble of the Temple of the World       Council

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They sat before us and they did not move

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we saw no       breath to stir the folds of their white togas

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we knew that       they were alive for a finger of the hand of the oldest rose       pointed to us and fell down again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This was the only thing which       moved for the lips of the oldest did not move as they said       Street Sweeper

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We felt the cords of our neck grow tight as our head rose higher       to look upon the faces of the Council and we were happy

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We knew       we had been guilty but now we had a way to atone for it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       would accept our Life Mandate and we would work for our       brothers gladly and willingly and we would erase our sin       against them which they did not know but we knew

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we were       happy and proud of ourselves and of our victory over ourselves

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We raised our right arm and we spoke and our voice was the       clearest the steadiest voice in the hall that day and we said       The will of our brothers be done

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we looked straight into the eyes of the Council but their       eyes were as cold blue glass buttons

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we went into the Home of the Street Sweepers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is a grey       house on a narrow street

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is a sundial in its courtyard by       which the Council of the Home can tell the hours of the day and       when to ring the bell

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When the bell rings we all arise from our       beds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sky is green and cold in our windows to the east

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The       shadow on the sundial marks off a halfhour while we dress and       eat our breakfast in the dining hall where there are five long       tables with twenty clay plates and twenty clay cups on each       table

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we go to work in the streets of the City with our       brooms and our rakes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: In five hours when the sun is high we       return to the Home and we eat our midday meal for which onehalf       hour is allowed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we go to work again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: In five hours the       shadows are blue on the pavements and the sky is blue with a       deep brightness which is not bright

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We come back to have our       dinner which lasts one hour

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the bell rings and we walk in       a straight column to one of the City Halls for the Social       Meeting

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Other columns of men arrive from the Homes of the       different Trades

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The candles are lit and the Councils of the       different Homes stand in a pulpit and they speak to us of our       duties and of our brother men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then visiting Leaders mount the       pulpit and they read to us the speeches which were made in the       City Council that day for the City Council represents all men       and all men must know

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we sing hymns the Hymn of       Brotherhood and the Hymn of Equality and the Hymn of the       Collective Spirit

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sky is a soggy purple when we return to       the Home

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the bell rings and we walk in a straight column to       the City Theatre for three hours of Social Recreation

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There a       play is shown upon the stage with two great choruses from the       Home of the Actors which speak and answer all together in two       great voices

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The plays are about toil and how good it is

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then       we walk back to the Home in a straight column

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sky is like a       black sieve pierced by silver drops that tremble ready to burst       through

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The moths beat against the street lanterns

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We go to our       beds and we sleep till the bell rings again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sleeping halls       are white and clean and bare of all things save one hundred beds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus have we lived each day of four years until two springs ago       when our crime happened

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus must all men live until they are       forty

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: At forty they are worn out

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: At forty they are sent to       the Home of the Useless where the Old Ones live

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Old Ones do       not work for the State takes care of them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They sit in the sun       in summer and they sit by the fire in winter

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They do not speak       often for they are weary

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Old Ones know that they are soon       to die

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When a miracle happens and some live to be fortyfive       they are the Ancient Ones and the children stare at them when       passing by the Home of the Useless

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Such is to be our life as       that of all our brothers and of the brothers who came before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Such would have been our life had we not committed our crime       which changed all things for us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And it was our curse which drove       us to our crime

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had been a good Street Sweeper and like all       our brother Street Sweepers save for our cursed wish to know

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       looked too long at the stars at night and at the trees and the       earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And when we cleaned the yard of the Home of the Scholars       we gathered the glass vials the pieces of metal the dried bones       which they had discarded

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wished to keep these things and to       study them but we had no place to hide them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we carried them       to the City Cesspool

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And then we made the discovery

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was on a day of the spring before last

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We Street Sweepers       work in brigades of three and we were with Union 53992 they of       the halfbrain and with International 48818

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Now Union 53992       are a sickly lad and sometimes they are stricken with       convulsions when their mouth froths and their eyes turn white

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But International 48818 are different

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They are a tall strong       youth and their eyes are like fireflies for there is laughter in       their eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We cannot look upon International 48818 and not       smile in answer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For this they were not liked in the Home of the       Students as it is not proper to smile without reason

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And also       they were not liked because they took pieces of coal and they       drew pictures upon the walls and they were pictures which made       men laugh

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But it is only our brothers in the Home of the Artists       who are permitted to draw pictures so International 48818 were       sent to the Home of the Street Sweepers like ourselves

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: International 48818 and we are friends

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is an evil thing to       say for it is a transgression the great Transgression of       Preference to love any among men better than the others since       we must love all men and all men are our friends

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So       International 48818 and we have never spoken of it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we know

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know when we look into each others eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And when we look       thus without words we both know other things also strange       things for which there are no words and these things frighten       us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So on that day of the spring before last Union 53992 were       stricken with convulsions on the edge of the City near the City       Theatre

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We left them to lie in the shade of

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: f the Theatre tent and       we went with International 48818 to finish our work

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We came       together to the great ravine behind the Theatre

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is empty save       for trees and weeds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Beyond the ravine there is a plain and       beyond the plain there lies the Uncharted Forest about which men       must not think

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We were gathering the papers and the rags which the wind had       blown from the Theatre when we saw an iron bar among the weeds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was old and rusted by many rains

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We pulled with all our       strength but we could not move it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we called International       48818 and together we scraped the earth around the bar

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Of a       sudden the earth fell in before us and we saw an old iron grill       over a black hole

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: International 48818 stepped back

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we pulled at the grill and       it gave way

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And then we saw iron rings as steps leading down a       shaft into a darkness without bottom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall go down we said to International 48818

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is forbidden they answered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We said The Council does not know of this hole so it cannot be       forbidden

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And they answered Since the Council does not know of this hole       there can be no law permitting to enter it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And everything which       is not permitted by law is forbidden

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we said We shall go none the less

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They were frightened but they stood by and watched us go

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We hung on the iron rings with our hands and our feet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We could       see nothing below us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And above us the hole open upon the sky       grew smaller and smaller till it came to be the size of a       button

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But still we went down

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then our foot touched the ground

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We rubbed our eyes for we could not see

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then our eyes became       used to the darkness but we could not believe what we saw

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No men known to us could have built this place nor the men known       to our brothers who lived before us and yet it was built by men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was a great tunnel

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Its walls were hard and smooth to the       touch it felt like stone but it was not stone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: On the ground       there were long thin tracks of iron but it was not iron it felt       smooth and cold as glass

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We knelt and we crawled forward our       hand groping along the iron line to see where it would lead

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But       there was an unbroken night ahead

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Only the iron tracks glowed       through it straight and white calling us to follow

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we       could not follow for we were losing the puddle of light behind       us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we turned and we crawled back our hand on the iron line

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And our heart beat in our fingertips without reason

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And then we       knew

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We knew suddenly that this place was left from the Unmentionable       Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So it was true and those Times had been and all the       wonders of those Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Hundreds upon hundreds of years ago men       knew secrets which we have lost

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we thought This is a foul       place

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They are damned who touch the things of the Unmentionable       Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But our hand which followed the track as we crawled       clung to the iron as if it would not leave it as if the skin of       our hand were thirsty and begging of the metal some secret fluid       beating in its coldness

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We returned to the earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: International 48818 looked upon us and       stepped back

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Equality 72521 they said your face is white

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we could not speak and we stood looking upon them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They backed away as if they dared not touch us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they       smiled but it was not a gay smile it was lost and pleading

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But       still we could not speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they said       We shall report our find to the City Council and both of us will       be rewarded

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And then we spoke

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our voice was hard and there was no mercy in       our voice

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We said       We shall not report our find to the City Council

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall not       report it to any men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They raised their hands to their ears for never had they heard       such words as these

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: International 48818 we asked will you report us to the       Council and see us lashed to death before your eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They stood straight all of a sudden and they answered Rather       would we die

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we said keep silent

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This place is ours

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This place       belongs to us Equality 72521 and to no other men on earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And       if ever we surrender it we shall surrender our life with it       also

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we saw that the eyes of International 48818 were full to       the lids with tears they dared not drop

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They whispered and       their voice trembled so that their words lost all shape       The will of the Council is above all things for it is the will       of our brothers which is holy

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But if you wish it so we shall       obey you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Rather shall we be evil with you than good with all our       brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: May the Council have mercy upon both our hearts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we walked away together and back to the Home of the Street       Sweepers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we walked in silence

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus did it come to pass that each night when the stars are high       and the Street Sweepers sit in the City Theatre we Equality       72521 steal out and run through the darkness to our place

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It       is easy to leave the Theatre when the candles are blown out and       the Actors come onto the stage no eyes can see us as we crawl       under our seat and under the cloth of the tent

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Later it is easy       to steal through the shadows and fall in line next to       International 48818 as the column leaves the Theatre

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is       dark in the streets and there are no men about for no men may       walk through the City when they have no mission to walk there

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Each night we run to the ravine and we remove the stones which       we have piled upon the iron grill to hide it from the men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Each       night for three hours we are under the earth alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have stolen candles from the Home of the Street Sweepers we       have stolen flints and knives and paper and we have brought them       to this place

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have stolen glass vials and powders and acids       from the Home of the Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Now we sit in the tunnel for three       hours each night and we study

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We melt strange metals and we mix       acids and we cut open the bodies of the animals which we find in       the City Cesspool

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have built an oven of the bricks we       gathered in the streets

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We burn the wood we find in the ravine

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The fire flickers in the oven and blue shadows dance upon the       walls and there is no sound of men to disturb us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have stolen manuscripts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is a great offense

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Manuscripts       are precious for our brothers in the Home of the Clerks spend       one year to copy one single script in their clear handwriting

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Manuscripts are rare and they are kept in the Home of the       Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we sit under the earth and we read the stolen       scripts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Two years have passed since we found this place

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And in       these two years we have learned more than we had learned in the       ten years of the Home of the Students

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have learned things which are not in the scripts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have       solved secrets of which the Scholars have no knowledge

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have       come to see how great is the unexplored and many lifetimes will       not bring us to the end of our quest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we wish no end to our       quest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wish nothing save to be alone and to learn and to       feel as if with each day our sight were growing sharper than the       hawks and clearer than rock crystal

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Strange are the ways of evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are false in the faces of our       brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are defying the will of our Councils

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We alone of       the thousands who walk this earth we alone in this hour are       doing a work which has no purpose save that we wish to do it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The       evil of our crime is not for the human mind to probe

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The nature       of our punishment if it be discovered is not for the human       heart to ponder

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Never not in the memory of the Ancient Ones       Ancients never have men done that which we are doing

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And yet there is no shame in us and no regret

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We say to       ourselves that we are a wretch and a traitor

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we feel no       burden upon our spirit and no fear in our heart

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And it seems to       us that our spirit is clear as a lake troubled by no eyes save       those of the sun

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And in our heartstrange are the ways of       evilin our heart there is the first peace we have known in       twenty years

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART TWO       Liberty 53000 Liberty fivethree thousand  Liberty       53000

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wish to write this name

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wish to speak it but we dare not       speak it above a whisper

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For men are forbidden to take notice of       women and women are forbidden to take notice of men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we       think of one among women they whose name is Liberty 53000 and       we think of no others

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The women who have been assigned to work       the soil live in the Homes of the Peasants beyond the City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Where       the City ends there is a great road winding off to the north and       we Street Sweepers must keep this road clean to the first       milepost

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is a hedge along the road and beyond the hedge       lie the fields

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The fields are black and ploughed and they lie       like a great fan before us with their furrows gathered in some       hand beyond the sky spreading forth from that hand opening wide       apart as they come toward us like black pleats that sparkle with       thin green spangles

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Women work in the fields and their white       tunics in the wind are like the wings of seagulls beating over       the black soil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And there it was that we saw Liberty 53000 walking along the       furrows

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their body was straight and thin as a blad

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: de of iron

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their eyes were dark and hard and glowing with no fear in them       no kindness and no guilt

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their hair was golden as the sun their       hair flew in the wind shining and wild as if it defied men to       restrain it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They threw seeds from their hand as if they deigned       to fling a scornful gift and the earth was a beggar under their       feet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stood still for the first time did we know fear and then       pain

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we stood still that we might not spill this pain more       precious than pleasure

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we heard a voice from the others call their name Liberty       53000 and they turned and walked back

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus we learned their       name and we stood watching them go till their white tunic was       lost in the blue mist

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And the following day as we came to the northern road we kept       our eyes upon Liberty 53000 in the field

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And each day       thereafter we knew the illness of waiting for our hour on the       northern road

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And there we looked at Liberty 53000 each day

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       know not whether they looked at us also but we think they did

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then one day they came close to the hedge and suddenly they       turned to us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They turned in a whirl and the movement of their       body stopped as if slashed off as suddenly as it had started

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They stood still as a stone and they looked straight upon us       straight into our eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There was no smile on their face and no       welcome

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But their face was taut and their eyes were dark

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then       they turned as swiftly and they walked away from us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the following day when we came to the road they smiled

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They smiled to us and for us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we smiled in answer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their head       fell back and their arms fell as if their arms and their thin       white neck were stricken suddenly with a great lassitude

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They       were not looking upon us but upon the sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they glanced at       us over their shoulder as we felt as if a hand had touched our       body slipping softly from our lips to our feet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Every morning thereafter we greeted each other with our eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       dared not speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is a transgression to speak to men of other       Trades save in groups at the Social Meetings

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But once standing       at the hedge we raised our hand to our forehead and then moved       it slowly palm down toward Liberty 53000

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Had the others seen       it they could have guessed nothing for it looked only as if we       were shading our eyes from the sun

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But Liberty 53000 saw it and       understood

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They raised their hand to their forehead and moved it       as we had

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Thus each day we greet Liberty 53000 and they       answer and no men can suspect

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not wonder at this new sin of ours

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is our second       Transgression of Preference for we do not think of all our       brothers as we must but only of one and their name is Liberty       53000

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not know why we think of them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not know why       when we think of them we feel all of a sudden that the earth is       good and that it is not a burden to live

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not think of them       as Liberty 53000 any longer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have given them a name in our       thoughts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We call them the Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But it is a sin to give       men names which distinguish them from other men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yet we call them       the Golden One for they are not like the others

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Golden One       are not like the others

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we take no heed of the law which says that men may not think       of women save at the Time of Mating

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This is the time each       spring when all the men older than twenty and all the women older       than eighteen are sent for one night to the City Palace of       Mating

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And each of the men have one of the women assigned to       them by the Council of Eugenics

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Children are born each winter       but women never see their children and children never know their       parents

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Twice have we been sent to the Palace of Mating but it       is an ugly and shameful matter of which we do not like to think

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had broken so many laws and today we have broken one more

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Today we spoke to the Golden One

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The other women were far off in the field when we stopped at the       hedge by the side of the road

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Golden One were kneeling alone       at the moat which runs through the field

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And the drops of water       falling from their hands as they raised the water to their lips       were like sparks of fire in the sun

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the Golden One saw us       and they did not move kneeling there looking at us and circles       of light played upon their white tunic from the sun on the water       of the moat and one sparkling drop fell from a finger of their       hand held as frozen in the air

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the Golden One rose and walked to the hedge as if they had       heard a command in our eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The two other Street Sweepers of our       brigade were a hundred paces away down the road

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we thought       that International 48818 would not betray us and Union 53992       would not understand

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we looked straight upon the Golden One       and we saw the shadows of their lashes on their white cheeks and       the sparks of sun on their lips

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we said       You are beautiful Liberty 53000

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Their face did not move and they did not avert their eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Only       their eyes grew wider and there was triumph in their eyes and       it was not triumph over us but over things we could not guess

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they asked       What is your name       Equality 72521 we answered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: You are not one of our brothers Equality 72521 for we do not       wish you to be

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We cannot say what they meant for there are no words for their       meaning but we know it without words and we knew it then

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No we answered nor are you one of our sisters

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If you see us among scores of women will you look upon us       We shall look upon you Liberty 53000 if we see you among all       the women of the earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem

title: Anthem
